entry.et: Middle English handel, from Old English handle; akin to Old English hand

def.dt: :a part that is designed especially to be grasped by the hand
:the total amount of money bet on a race, game, or event
:a means of understanding or controlling can't quite get a handle on things
:into a state of sudden and violent anger usually used with fly
:to try or examine (as by touching, feeling, or moving) with the hand handle silk to judge its weight
:to manage with the hands handle a horse
:to deal with in writing or speaking or in the plastic arts
:to have overall responsibility for supervising or directing :manage a lawyer handles all my affairs
:to train and act as second for (a boxer)
:to put up with :stand can't handle the heat
:to act on or perform a required function with regard to handle the day's mail
:to engage in the buying, selling, or distributing of (a commodity)
:to act, behave, or respond in a certain way when handled or directed a car that handles well
